Reviews.Title: Good phone but........
Reviews.Author: joshg0h79
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and am happy with most features. It has a 5 megapix camera. watch most video sites and an endless android app market. but this phone has a huge downfall! Memory! after all the market apps you only have 170mb of storage (which I've never seen) in which may sound like enough but with only 2 apps @7-10mb and 10-12 small .5-2mb it keeps telling me insufficient memory. I would recommend for anyone who looking for a reasonably priced android except for this one prob. oh yeah, cheaper at metro pcs!

Reviews.Title: I should of waited.
Reviews.Author: asylum
Reviews.Content: I am gonna be real with you,and say this phone is great,i have had this phone for a little bit more then two week's.But yes there is a but,only thing i hate about this phone,is the internal memory it's not a lot it's on the mb area.I had to set my phone back to factory setting's because my memory was getting low,now they have a setting where you can clear your memory by removing stuff,but that was not even working for me.So i put it back to factory default,it gave me back 70 something mb now that probably seem's like a lot,but no it is not.Now they do give you a 2GB SD card,but some of the app's you download wont allow to move it from phone,to SD card.And the last.final thing that has happen to me is,the second week when i got the phone,my phone rebooted two time's.Now i have not have that problem sense.But i thought i will throw it out there.Now will i recommend this phone?Yes if you want a money saving smart phone like me,No if you can afford something better.They just came out with the Huawei Activa(tm) 4G,for $149.99 if i would had waited i would had got that one,it's only 20 buck's more,and has a bigger internal memory,and is 4G.Hope this help's anyone that's looking into getting a new phone.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for a first android phone
Reviews.Author: SaintTJ
Reviews.Content: HTC Wildfire S Prepaid Android Phone (MetroPCS)As with most prepaid android phones, don't expect it to be any where near as good as phones such as an iPhone, Galaxy, or most other contract phones. The battery life on standby has lasted about 8 hours, with continuous text around 3-4  hours. Talk time would kill the battery at abou 1 1/2 to 2 hours if you're likely. Depending on the prepaid carrier expect a variety of bloat ware, constantly slowly the device even after forcing close such apps. Voice quality is decent when the device decides to function somewhat properly. Not that great experience, but was expecting more considering the short experience with other HTC products and recommendations from friends and coworkers.As a prepaid android set I would recommend this to teens and folks who aren't familiar with the operating system. If you have experience with android devices and want to cut your bill with a prepaid service I would look else where.

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Darima
Reviews.Content: I love this phone because: really smart phone, easy menu, all apps are avaliable, understandable from first touch  setting, durable screen, convinient size and great camera with 5mgpx. I newer open manual, menu is really created for instinct usage.I was so happy to find prepaid phone with my original phone service. I was  surprised, when MetroPCS offered me better price than Amazon.If you want to be updated with phone, but not ready spend huge money- Wildfire for you!

Reviews.Title: A fragile phone with limited usefulness
Reviews.Author: Syd McCabe
Reviews.Content: This is cute lightweight phone. However, this phone has a number of unfortunate problems that make it a bad choice.1) The battery life is quite short, less than 24 if phone is not in use and even shorter if the phone is used for even one phone call. I replaced the battery and the problem remained.2) The internal memory is quite small and there a a large number of pre-loaded apps that take up most of the space. This would not be a problem if some of these apps could be transferred to a memory chip (mine was 8 GB), but they are not movable.3) The final problem is that the phone is physically fragile so it broke even with a protective case. If the glass breaks then you can hear the phone ring, but you cannot answer it. A most frustrating situation.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone for the money!
Reviews.Author: John Hwang
Reviews.Content: I bought this to serve as a micro tablet for my kids - it will never be activated, and operates WiFi only.Pro+ perfect size & weight for little hands and fingers+ good display and multi-touch keeps the device simple+ full Android market and MP3/MP4 support+ good HTC designCon- low-ish resolution- slow-ish CPUWow= sturdy design survived a fall down the stairs= HTC Sense & widgets are fun for kids= under $70 bucks!!!For how little I paid, I'm very satisfied with this Android device.  Sure, it could be bigger, faster, etc.  But not at the price I paid.AlsoHaving owned this for almost 2 months, I am still very satisfied with it for my kids.  It plays Angry Birds and Cut the Rope just fine, tho the load times are kinda long.  The smaller screen means that video sizes are very reasonable, so you can put a *lot* of hVGA video on an 8 GB card!

Reviews.Title: Um... no.
Reviews.Author: Sonia Chaudhary "saffron_rose"
Reviews.Content: This phone sucks. I have used it for almost a year and a half and got used to it but the biggest frustration is it's lack of internal memory. I can't download any apps because there is no room and nothing will move to the SD card. And now after a year and a half it has totally quit. It turns itself on and off every 5 seconds so finally I just took the battery out. I'm in the market for a new phone now and you can be sure I'm going to find one with enough internal memory to make it worth having a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: I wouldn't do it if I were you
Reviews.Author: PenName
Reviews.Content: I got the HTC Wildfire because it's the smallest smart phone I could find and I don't want a frikken tablet in my pants.Yes, I read the reviews about it having absolutely no internal memory, but I just thought-- whatever! I'll just get a huge SD card and move everything from the phone to the card, no biggie, right?! WRONG! Most apps aren't programmed with the ability to be saved to the SD card. Why? My 13 year old cousin makes amateur apps and can easily program the app so it has the functionality to be moved to the SD card, but can the dbags  at facebook figure it out? No, apparently they can't. So I deleted facebook because my phone didn't have room for it. Why, you ask again?! Because this phone was loaded with so much bloatware right out of the box that after downloading probably 4 apps, it was full.No biggie again, right?! I'll just root it and delete everything. WRONG AGAIN! Rooting is kind of intimidating for someone with no programming experience. Also, rooting your phone will void the warranty- so you better hope you don't screw it up. My cousin could have figured out how, but didn't do it, because in his words "even if I root it and delete everything, you'll still only have 200mb, it's not even worth it."When I got a smart phone I naturally assumed that it could do more than my dumb phone. I was wrong again. I had to download apps just so it would do the things my dumb phone did. The calendar is complete and absolute garbage. I click on a date and it goes to a different day. I enter an event and tell it to remind me 2 hours before, it whispers a beep or two 15 minutes before the event starts. It has no option to make it loud, like my other phone. I have to manually set my alarm for each and every event, because I can't trust the calendar app.I touch something and have to wait 30 seconds for it to respond. It’s so frustrating to do anything on the internet. I rarely get my MMS messages. You can't take selfies with this camera. It only has a forward facing cam and a digital button on the LCD screen. None of the actual buttons will take a photo, so you better know exactly where the LCD button is without looking. The phone is pathetically quiet, even on speaker. I hate having phones next to my head, I feel myself getting brain cancer.Anyway, if you do get this phone, good luck. I hope all you want to do with it is not hear your phone calls and get stalked by google

Reviews.Title: Not impressed.
Reviews.Author: Mandy K
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get my first Android Platform Smart-Phone and INITIALLY, I liked all the bells and whistles.I've had this phone for almost 2 weeks, and have had to do a "factory reset" on it TWICE because most ofthe features stopped working / froze altogether.I downloaded the recommended Software Update and things just went down-hill from there.  It will not connect to the mobile network any longer, the keyboard changed (for the worse) and I'm unable to delete apps to try to make more space on it without first connecting it to the computer and setting it as a hard drive.Overall very dissatisfied with this phone and do not recommend it to anyone.I had an old Samsung Caliber before this, and will probably end up switching back to it.Waste of money and time.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PHONE FOR THE PRICE.
Reviews.Author: K "K"
Reviews.Content: I THINK THAT THIS PHONE GOES ABOVE AND BEYOND FOR THE PRICE. WORKS NICE AND FAST WITH THE ANDROID PLATFORM. WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: Yet another internal memory complaint
Reviews.Author: T. Harrison-Kelly
Reviews.Content: That fact that I'm even typing a review about a product should tell you how strongly I feel about it.  I really like this phone.  Internet is pretty speedy, all the functions work well, video quality and pic quality are great.  BUT, it comes pre-loaded with a bunch of unusable and unerasable apps and leaves you room for like two apps.  I just had to delete Words with Friends just to be able to download the mandatory system update from HTC.  And now that I've downloaded the system update, no other apps will fit!!  Smartphone fail:(.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: 4mytiger
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome phone.  Now with your rebate through metro pcs you can get this phone for $89.00, is this insane.  This is a great deal and you will love this phone

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money!
Reviews.Author: Vee
Reviews.Content: Cheaply made phone. The HTC Evo 4G or HTC One are much better. This phone drops calls regularly. Difficult to surf the web...lots of freezing whether using WiFi or cellular network. Slow loading. Total waste of money in my opinion.It takes forever to get a customer service rep to go over billing issues. Call the customer service number on the main website and you get infomercials! If you don't buy the "special trip" or go for the "special added voucher" you get disconnected! Call the main store and they forward you to another customer support number. Then wait FOREVER with more "added value features" you can purchase repeated over and over in recordings while you wait and wait on the phone. Unable to pay bill on the website despite multiple calls to customer service...but they are willing to have me call in and pay a service charge to pay over the phone even though they can't get the website to function either.Save your money. Save your time. Go ELSEWHERE!!!

Reviews.Title: Too cheap
Reviews.Author: HENRY
Reviews.Content: It was not a durable cell phone and you could not download a lot of games on it  are other apps.

Reviews.Title: bad buy
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: Wost buy ever phone will not read sd cards also the battery life is horrible and very low storage on phone

Reviews.Title: Missing Items In Box
Reviews.Author: RaineStarr
Reviews.Content: Items Missing In Box(1) Refference Guide(2) 2GB Sd Card(3) USB CableAnd (4) 1 Yr Warranty Paper'sAre Missing........Sooooooo.....?!PLEASE Send The Four Missing ItemsAnd I Will Give A 5 Star Rate'nInstead Of 3 Stars"Thanks"Received My Phone OnOctober 28-2013Items Missing From BoxAs Detaild Previously

Reviews.Title: What A Complete and Utter Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Mark Thaler
Reviews.Content: So I guess I shouldn't expect too much from a MetroPCS phone right?  I mean after all, it's MetroPCS.  I've had my HTC Wildfire S "SmartPhone" for about a month now and at first it was great because before then I had those cheapie little flip phones that didn't amount to much at all.  I liked the features and the touch screen.  One thing I learned very quickly is that this phone has NO STORAGE SPACE.  And when I say this,I mean internal storage.  You can get all the upgraded SIM Cards that you want, but it won't make a difference since you can't transfer any of the MetroPCS pre-installed apps to it (not to mention, you cannot delete any of the MetroPCS pre-installed apps from your phone unless you "root" it, but then that will make it go out of warranty and also you will  not be able to get any official phone updates once you do this).A suggestion for those who want to use downloaded apps such as Facebook....don't download/install the Facebook app...you can easily use Facebook through the phone's web browser and it's already setup for Facebook mobile, so that way you won't have to waste space on your phone or SIM card (yes, you can move downloaded apps to the SIM card).  Some apps are smaller in space, but you won't be able to get much, so if you frequently use Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest and so on, you won't be able to use all those apps.  You can probably have one downloaded app on your phone at a time!Another thing with this phone is that you constantly have to charge it...seriously purchase a car charger and charge it wherever you are able to, no kidding!  If you're at a friend's, ask them if you can plug your phone into their USB drive...or into an outlet...charge this thing every chance  you get because if you don't...even if you decide to take a nap, that phone is gonna die!  I took a nap for 2 hours today and woke up to a dead phone...again.  Charge it overnight!  otherwise, that alarm you set is not going to go off and you'll be late for work or school, or wherever you have to be!But my recommendation is not to get this phone, because it SUCKS and I really shoulda read reviews first on this, but oh well live and learn (facepalm...sigh).Oh and by the way, if you try to call the MetroPCS number, it doesn't go to an actual phone number for Customer Service, it goes to an app on the phone with FAQ's and that's about it.  You either have to go into the MetroPCS store where they'll tell you "I'm sorry but we can't uninstall the MetroPCS apps" in person, or you can get a rude Chat representative through their website who sounds like they don't want you to interrupt their solitaire game with your ridiculous questions.  Your choice!  Either no help, or bad help!Truth.

Reviews.Title: Bad, slow phone, basically terrible in every way
Reviews.Author: Robert Finley
Reviews.Content: This phone is terrible.  I've had mine for about a year - prepaid, too - and hate it.  What do I hate about it?1) It is exceptionally slow. I have almost nothing stored on my phone other than contacts.  Nevertheless, this phone is phenomenally slow.2) Battery life.  Even with wifi turned off, battery life is abominable.  I have an iphone for work that I use constantly.  Even with frequent use, the iPhone significantly outperforms the Wildfire, even when the Wildfire is simply left on without use.3) Settings routinely turn back on.  I don't want my phone's LED to blink when I have a voicemail.  I have adjusted this setting on my Wildfire.  Nevertheless, a few hours later, it blinks if I have voicemail.  Settings' permanence is sketchy at best.4) The spellcheck is pretty bad and the words not in the dictionary are rather simple ones.  There is no intelligence to the spellcheck.I wasted money on this terrible prepaid phone.  I hope you don't do the same.

Reviews.Title: Small, good value phone
Reviews.Author: Rez "90% minimum"
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good value for the money. The phone has a nice feel in your hand, is light, and has a nice camera. It's processor is nothing amazing, but pretty fast given its size and price. Internal memory becomes a hassle as certain apps cannot be stored on the micro-sd card (but you can expand the memory to 32 gb with a high cap micro-sd card).

Reviews.Title: SUCKS
Reviews.Author: Amore
Reviews.Content: I expected the phone to be in better condition it had more scratches than what the description said and to top it off the phone dies really fast. also it wil not read my sim card. Didn't come with a charger for the asking price she could've threw one in. I will never buy a used phone again lesson learned. Payed to much for this trash. Oh & the cover she threw in was more loose than a cow.

Reviews.Title: The worst phone I have ever had
Reviews.Author: Codejack
Reviews.Content: The unremovable preinstalled apps (facebook, Twitter, etc) take up so much room after updating that the phone no longer functions properly. I can't make outgoing calls, and the only way I can hang up from incoming calls is to open the case and remove the battery.

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought it was...
Reviews.Author: Perrrfectangel06
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone in hopes of being able to download more apps, music, etc.. The internal memory is so low I can download about 3-4 apps depending on their file size. It doesn't matter what size your SD card is if it won't let you download and transfer to the card. super disappointed. On a good note it does take good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not for users that love  to download apps!
Reviews.Author: Me-Me
Reviews.Content: I do not like this phone far as memory and being able to download apps.its a nice looking phone and has a good camera. but thats about it! I would not recommend it for folks that use the internet a lot.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: Alexandra
Reviews.Content: Bought the phone thinking it was unlocked but my mistake the phone works well and metro pcs has good plans.wish I could have used it.

Reviews.Title: let down by phone features.
Reviews.Author: jeff wright
Reviews.Content: I expected this phone to be bigger, also to be able to download a simple app such as instagram. i dont reccomend this phone.

Reviews.Author: Carley Jean
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for a year and easily said, I'd rather break my leg than have another phone like it. It's a good phone if all you want to do is make calls but don't bother trying to download an app because the internal storage is WAY to low.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: It'sme2
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone as a gift, the person received it very fast.  We had a bit of a hard time activating it, but after talking with customer service it worked perfectly.  They are very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome seller!
Reviews.Author: Arnaldo
Reviews.Content: The product arrived fast and just like I ordered it. It was well worth it and I am so glad I went through with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: I would give negative stars if I could
Reviews.Author: J. Hale
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this phone is the most disappointing product I've ever purchased in 23 years of life. That should certainly tell you something.I spent $250 on this when I bought it for my brother (I believe last year). It's a decent phone besides one crucial aspect - HTC felt it was ok to put in a paltry memory card. How big of a deal is that, you ask? AN ENORMOUS DEAL. My brother is constantly giving me his phone to 'fix it'. What am I fixing, you ask? This annoying popup telling him he's out of memory and can't even open a friggen text message. How basic is that?To put it into context, he has four (4) apps on his phone. He started off with ~10, but he has been steadily deleting them as his annoying "no memory to open a damn text message" popup started appearing.The worst part is that there is really no fix for this other than rooting the phone and moving stuff to an SD card. I'm just beyond pissed that HTC could charge $250 for this piece of crap, and not even give you a 1 GB internal memory stick or something. I'm simply asking for a usable phone that can open a text message, and this "smart phone", in the era of smart phones, can't even do that. Pretty pathetic that my phone from 2002 is more competent than this phone is, frankly.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: sergio vila
Reviews.Content: recibido antes de tiempo,muy buen servicio y excelentes condiciones,el empaque y las condiciones del producto excelente,contento con todo y relamente lo que pedi

Reviews.Title: Very good phone
Reviews.Author: Brenda McLean
Reviews.Content: I am not into gadgets but this is a very good phone and easy to use.  Still enjoying using it.

Reviews.Title: Very little memory and battery drained when you're not even using it
Reviews.Author: LastoftheUchiha
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for like a good few months and this is my first ever android smart phone and the internal memory is ridiculously small smaller than a midget. I cant even look at my pictures without it telling me. And the fact that the WIFI and the Internet itself drains the battery on the Wildfire is very sad like cmon really? I cant wait until I have the money to get the Galaxy S3 when it comes to Metro. Oh yeah and f*** Apple

Reviews.Title: I hated this phone
Reviews.Author: Betty1234
Reviews.Content: You can only have one app and it tells you u don't have enough memory , I bought a 32 gig micro sd card and it didn't help any because I couldn't transfer the apps this is over all the worst phone . I wouldn't recommend it for anyone

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Cyndicate
Reviews.Content: It's a great dinky phone. I mean its a Metro phone with no contract so of course it's gonna be dinky. For the prince its really modest. It runs app's well. Run low end games really well like 99c games or 1.99 games. Video streaming is well it does need the ability to update adobe flash. Recommend this phone if you want an android to read ebooks, play low end games, music, & streaming. Can't really ask for much since its a metro. I advice you all to buy an DROID from verizon and flash it over to MetroPCS it is way better than this and around the same price range as well.

Reviews.Title: worst choice
Reviews.Author: Ardin
Reviews.Content: The internal memory is so low, it's almost unbelievable. You really cannot remove any of the many factory installed bloatware programs (like Peep? I guess it's Twitter's weirdo cousin or something. Random programs like that are there to stay) And almost no app you want can be moved to an SD card. It will truly hold only 3 or 4 apps successfully. I thought it was possible that the other reviewers were exaggerating over just how low and prohibitive it is really but they are all so right on. I literally have to clear out the memory every day (which is a pain because all your passwords, histories, ALL browser information disappears) or the phone will freak out and not sync your mail and keep annoyingly alerting you to low memory. Many times my phone will not even ring and go directly to voicemail but that's probably more of Metro's fault and not necessarily the phone. I often have to restart the phone because the internet will flat out just stop working at least a few times a day when the phone seems to get overwhelmed. The only positive things I can think of is that the phone can keep a charge alot better than other smartphones especially with JuiceDefender installed, you can store pictures/videos on the sd card, it does hold Wifi connections decently, and I like it's size. I feel like it's way too expensive for what you recieve. HTC is a brilliant operating system, I've owned the EVO 3D and loved it but this phone is just the worst. Maybe ok for a child's first cell phone but that's it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: G. Kapukui "Apex"
Reviews.Content: I have had the same phone for the past 5 years(Motorola SLVR). I have not upgraded do to the fact that all the phones on the market have been getting bigger. I think personal electronics should be small, sleek and brilliant. Then, I found the HTC Wildfire S. I devote my time to REAL life contact and in saying that all the video media streaming is not of big interest to me, but this phone can access youtube with par to subpar resolution due to pixilation with minor delay. The installed Goolge maps feature is perfect for finding my way around town, home and away. Its very convenient. I upgraded my sd card to a 32g card, the phone comes with a 2gig card, I have almost 2000 songs that I can listen to while driving via the 3.5mm output jack. all n all its everthing I need to keep me updated with current information(weather, news, location, social networks). although there is a couple of issues that I feel should have been included like, a note pad for messages, an audible alert when a call/message has been missed but these functions can be downloaded from the android app store. Im satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: No internal storage
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Since 1st day I keep getting low internal fone storage pop up,please delete programs.I havent installed any.I have large sd card but the crap tht comes on fone wont go on card,u cant uninstall any of it.I have to clean cashe 2+a day,can only install 1-2apps but hve to unistall often due to fone storage too low to function.crap!

Reviews.Title: I want to throw this phone in the street!
Reviews.Author: A. Helton
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for several months now. What I have seen, first is a lot of unnessary bells and whistles. My biggest gripe, however, is the "ghost" or "phantom" touches that lock down the phone. Some times the touch pad is completely unresponsive. This results in missed calls or the 1 hour text message. I contacted the company's customer support and to their credit they were quick with a response but no real solution. "Try rebooting it" "You may have to do a factory reset" to which all contacts will be deleted. So I'm stuck with this glitchy phone until some one takes it and slams it on the floor. Then I can justify spending another 130 on a phone.Do your self a favor, buy the cheap $50.00 button phone at metro.

Reviews.Title: HTC Wildfire S Prepaid Android Phone
Reviews.Author: J. Gilbert
Reviews.Content: This is a good all around smart phone it's a small phone packed with a lot of features too. I like that this phone has all the features that all the other smartphones have and the CDMA SIM card compatabilty that I haven't seen in any other smartphones rather it's a prepaid phone or a contract phone. I would recremend this phone to any one who is looking for a good all around prepaid smartphone this phone has all the features you could possably want in a smartphone and at a realy good price too. In fact I'm going to buy this phone for my nice so she can have a good And relieable phone to use when she goes to collage in the fall. That's how much I like this phone. I'll probably be getting one for my nefffew when he graduates high school too.

Reviews.Title: Small & Smart...
Reviews.Author: Delando
Reviews.Content: I have had my phone for a month now.I am glad to have gotten it.This phone is small yes...but It carries a big stick.It has plenty of  memory both inner and SD.oh and the timeing couldn't been better.  Thanks Amazon 4 my metro ...a happy customer Delando shops again Mazyck

Reviews.Title: HATE IT
Reviews.Author: Cadlynne
Reviews.Content: THIS PHONE IS TOTAL CRAP WHEN IT COMES TO MEMORY, I WAS ONLY ABLE TO DOWNLOAD ONE APP (FACEBOOK) AND AFTER THAT I WAS UNABLE TO EVEN USE MY MUSIC OR GO INTO MY GALLERY. LOVE THE STYLE,TEXTURE,HTC SENSE BUT THE MEMORY IS FLAT OUT UN USEFUL. I RECCOMEND THIS TO PEOPLE WITHOUT A LIFE OR OLDER PEOPLE THAT BARELY USE THIS PHONE

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY
Reviews.Author: Panha Vy
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone from an authorized dealer for $25 with activation. Its is a piece of S#%T. Do not buy it. the internal memory is the smallest I've ever seen. you can't even download any more apps, because it will not let you use other apps(included text messaging) because the memory is so low. sometimes you can't even text without deleting some pics(and you can't even store that many to begin with, maybe less than 10). and you can't delete pics because the memory is so low..."please free up some storage space before using this app". and when texting, the keyboard REALLY lags. sometimes won't even work, forcing you to restart the phone. the camera is HORRIBLE. I don't know why other people are giving this phone good reviews, but you get what you pay for. so, take my advice and STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: SUCKS
Reviews.Author: delores
Reviews.Content: THIS PHONE SUCKS THE MEMORY IS VERY LOW & YOU CAN'T REALLY DO MUCH ON IT WITHOUT YOUR MEMORY BEING FULL ALL THE TIME I WASTED 190 FOR KNOW REASON SMH.

Reviews.Title: oh ya i forgot
Reviews.Author: Trent Simas
Reviews.Content: make sure u get everything in the box. it said comes with 2gb sd card..but no sd card.i have asked if they can send it to me and no reply

Reviews.Title: does not work with T-mobile
Reviews.Author: Elisa W.
Reviews.Content: This phone does not work with T-mobile. I charged it all night, and it still wouldn't even turn on. It's too bad because it has a big screen and a 5 MP camera, so it should be a nice phone.

Reviews.Title: The worse phone I've ever had!!!
Reviews.Author: Ellla
Reviews.Content: The worse phone I've ever had!!! Don't waist your money. It has no internal memory and you can delete any of the apps it comes with it!You will be able to only call and use text msg. No e-mails, no facebook, twitter, games, bank, NOTHING!!!

ProductInfo.Features:
Android Platform
camera with flash light
wifi capablity
ProductInfo.Name: HTC Wildfire S Prepaid Android Phone (MetroPCS)
